Mike Pence ruled out a White House bid in a letter sent to supporters that also fueled speculation he is instead planning a run for governor. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence wrote in the letter. "In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana." Mike Pence has two public events scheduled for today. Darrell Issa

Larry Page speaking to the European Parliament, 2009. An "unexpected shakeup" went down at Google today. Larry Page, company co-founder, will take over as CEO effective April 4. Page, 37, is reclaiming the top job from Eric Schmidt , who had been brought in as CEO a decade ago because Google's investors believed the company needed a more mature leader, reports KTVU. " Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google's executive chairman." This news comes on the heels of

for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.
